item.title: Simpsons Synopsis Generator
item.description:
This is a short witty intro that I imagine an article like this would have.

This is the First Header

import asyncio
 
@asyncio.coroutine
def my_coroutine(seconds_to_sleep=3):
    print('my_coroutine sleeping for: {0} seconds'.format(seconds_to_sleep))
    yield from asyncio.sleep(seconds_to_sleep)
 
 
loop = asyncio.get_event_loop()
loop.run_until_complete(
    asyncio.gather(my_coroutine())
)
loop.close()

Another Test

So if I gave you an example of inline python code, such as class Car(object): it probably wouldn’t highlight

Time for Header Two

Hugo is terrifyingly quick, I look over at the browser and it’s already rendered the entire new site

I wonder if inline fenced code like my_python = 3**2 highlights.

Nope
